meanings.definition: To make larger or increase in size.
meanings.sent1: She decided to augmenter the cake recipe by adding more flour.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used fertilizer to augmenter the growth of his crops.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to augmenter the rabbit, but it ended up being a giant carrot instead!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to augmenter the brightness of the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist used vibrant colors to augmenter the beauty of the painting.

meanings.definition: One who augments or increases something.
meanings.sent1: As an augmenter, his job was to enhance the productivity of the team.
meanings.sent2: The augmenter suggested new strategies to boost sales.
meanings.sent3: The augmenter at the bakery always came up with creative ways to improve recipes.
meanings.sent4: She was like an augmenter of joy, spreading happiness wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The augmenter of knowledge, the librarian helped students find valuable resources.
